result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Yahn

2:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brian K. Yahn appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. Requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
